alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 4:22PM PST until November 12 at 2:07PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River at Potlach has crested and will slowly recede tonight into Sunday morning. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including Potlatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM PST Saturday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM PST Saturday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 14.4 feet Thursday afternoon. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 12/20/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 330 AM PST.
